item.title: Cookie Run: Kingdom - Best Guild Battle Teams
item.description:
In Cookie Run: Kingdom , the Guild Battle game mode is one of the best ways to earn Flame of Unity, Heroic Torches, and Heroic Medals. You can donate the first one to boost your Guild’s EXP, while the other two can be traded for valuable rewards like Epic Cookie Soulstones, Toppings, Soul Essences, and even Magic Cookie Cutters.

Each season (which usually lasts around four weeks), Guild Battle introduces two fresh bosses that start at level one. You can challenge each boss up to nine times, and the more damage they take, the stronger they become — leveling up their stats and skills along the way. Once the season wraps up, every participant earns Guild Battle rewards. With only nine chances to fight each boss, having a strong setup is everything. So, here's a rundown on the best Guild Battle teams to help you make the most of these boss fights in Cookie Run: Kingdom .

Best Cookie Run: Kingdom Guild Battle Teams

Here are the best Guild Battle team combos to try out in CRK :

Guild Battle Team Build 1

Cookies

This build leans more toward high-tier Cookies, including Beast and Ancient rarities. If you use them, they can shave off way more HP from Guild Bosses than most others. A lot of them also have specific Resonant Toppings, which you can grab from the Catnip Shops or the Event Shop.

As for Beascuits, if you don’t have the Tainted versions, the regular ones (like Legendary Sweet Beascuits instead of Legendary Tainted Gleaming Sweet) will still do the trick — though the higher the rarity, the more damage you’ll dish out.

The aforementioned team mostly features Ancient and Legendary Cookies, which you can grab from the Might of the Ancients banner or the regular Gacha. They’re great for making the most of your limited boss fight attempts — especially if their levels, upgrades, Toppings, Tarts, and Beascuits are all maxed out. Also, try to use the Awakened versions of Ancient Cookies for the best results.

CRK players who only have Super Epic and Epic Cookies can stick to this build. If Icicle Yeti Cookie isn’t part of your collection, you can swap it out for Cream Ferret — just make sure you’ve got at least one healer on the team.

If you don’t have any Special Cookies unlocked yet, you can go with the Wedding Cake and Black Forest combo or try the new Agar Agar and Fire Spirit duo.

item.title: Stardew Valley: 9 Things to Do in Your Second Year
item.description:
Stardew Valley is more than just a wholesome farming simulator. Apart from spending their days raising crops and animals on the farm, players can engage in many other activities and find their sense of purpose in the countryside. From renovating their late Grandpa’s Farm to meeting up with the people of Pelican Town, players can even get married and start their own family.

Once they’ve spent the first year in Stardew Valley clearing up the old, run-down farm and befriending the townsfolk, players can finally move on to do bigger and better things. Keep reading to find a comprehensive list of all the things one absolutely must do in the second year in Stardew Valley .

Updated April 17, 2025, by Usama Ali: Having established the groundwork in your first year, Year 2 is an ideal time to broaden your horizons and experiment with new approaches to farming. With the launch of Stardew Valley’s 1.6 update, many fresh experiences are waiting for you as you step into your second year on the farm. We’ve updated this guide with a few more activities you should do in your second year so that you'll get to experience much of what the update has to offer and continue to build an even more amazing farm.

Get Ready For Grandpa’s Evaluation

Impress Grandpa’s Ghost

One of the most important things that players should actively focus on in Year 2 is preparing for Grandpa’s Evaluation. Grandpa's Evaluation is an interesting way for the character's deceased grandpa to assess their progress on the farm. Grandpa’s Ghost returns on Spring 1, Year 3 and lights up candles around his Shrine – which is situated in the north-west corner of the farm.

To impress Grandpa’s Ghost and light up all four candles, players need to complete certain milestones and earn at least 12 points. Even though it feels challenging at first, acing Grandpa’s Evaluation is certainly possible with the right strategies.

Level Up Skills and Professions

Get Specialized Perks

Once they’ve learned the ropes of the five core skills – Farming, Fishing, Foraging, Mining, and Combat , players should focus on leveling them up in Year 2. Each skill has ten levels, and at Levels 5 and 10, players get to choose a profession for that specific skill.

Higher skill levels grant access to better tools and equipment, like Iridium Sprinklers at Farming Level 9, which can increase the watering range. Besides this, as the player’s skills level up, they’ll get better quality crops and animal products – which sell for more gold. All Professions have certain perks, such as the Shepherd profession, which allows players to befriend barn animals quicker.

Invest in Kegs and Hops

The Ticket to Insane Profits

One of the best ways to run a successful farm is to invest in Kegs and start a winery. A Keg is a type of Artisan Equipment that can create valuable Artisan Goods, like Wine and Pale Ale. These Artisan Goods are significantly more valuable than the produce they come from.

Pale Ale has a selling price of 300 gold coins , whereas the price of Wine depends on the price of fruit put into the keg . As such, it’s a wise decision to craft plenty of Kegs and grow Hops in the summer. It takes about 2,250 minutes, which is equivalent to one to two in-game days for a Keg to process 1 Hop into Pale Ale. Higher quality Hops will produce higher quality Pale Ale, which sells for even more. Hence, this is a surefire way to make money and have a reliable income stream in the Valley.

Upgrade the Farmhouse

Get A New And Improved Home

Upgrading the farmhouse in Stardew Valley is a great way for players to improve their comfort and functionality in the countryside. While they may not have enough resources in the first year, players should definitely upgrade the farmhouse once in their second year as it would open up a whole new world of possibilities.

Robin, the town’s carpenter, can upgrade the farmhouse three times . The first farmhouse upgrade adds a kitchen and a double bed, allowing players to get married to their chosen partners. The second upgrade adds two new rooms and increases the overall size of the house while allowing players to have children. The third and final upgrade adds a cellar under the house where players can store casks to age products like wine and cheese, making them more profitable.

Players can customize the interior of their farmhouse with furniture and wallpapers purchased from Pierre's General Store or JojaMart.

Get Married

Find The Love Of Your Life & Settle Down

Getting married in Stardew Valley adds a whole new layer of fun and excitement to farm life. There are 12 marriage candidates in Pelican Town, 6 bachelors and 6 bachelorettes. Players can pursue any of the villagers, regardless of their character’s gender.

Before they can get married, players will need to reach ten friendship hearts with their desired partner and upgrade the farmhouse at least once. The day after reaching ten friendship hearts with their partner, players can propose to them using a Mermaid’s Pendant. If their partner accepts, players will get married in 3 days. Once they’re married, their spouse moves into the farmhouse.

Experiment with New Crops

Maximize Your Farm’s Potential

In your first year, you were probably more focused on establishing the basics, figuring out what grows when, and maybe prioritizing crops with the best immediate profit to get your farm off the ground. With the foundations laid out, Year 2 is a perfect time to try out new crops. Update 1.6 introduced four new crops: carrots, Summer Squash , broccoli, and Powdermelon .

Of course, different crops thrive in different seasons. So, by experimenting, you can figure out the most profitable options for each time of year and make the most of your farmland and time. Make sure to try out all the options and see which crops yield the most profitable wines, honeys, pickles, and jellies. Since you’ll have a wider variety of crops and forageables, Year 2 is also a great time to experiment with more cooking and crafting recipes in Stardew Valley .

Start Finding Mystery Boxes

What’s in Your Box?

Introduced in Stardew Valley 1.6, Mystery Boxes are unlocked once you’ve spent 50 days in the Valley or collected the second Prize Ticket from the billboard. These are special containers that can be found through various activities like fishing, mining, foraging (from artifact spots and trees), monster drops, and even as rewards from the new festivals (Desert Festival, Trout Derby, SquidFest) and Mayor Lewis' Prize Machine.

Similar to geodes, Mystery Boxes cannot be opened on your farm. Instead, you need to take them to Clint at the Blacksmith in Pelican Town in Stardew Valley , who will open them for a fee of 25g each. There are even "Golden Mystery Boxes" that you can potentially find once you've achieved the Foraging Mastery, which contain even better loot. Some of the rarer items found in Mystery Boxes, especially Golden Mystery Boxes, can be incredibly helpful for late-game progression. As such, starting to collect them in Year 2 gives you a head start.

Complete the Community Center or JojaMart Bundles

Choose Your Path Wisely

In Stardew Valley , players have a choice between restoring the town’s rundown Community Center or supporting the corporate giant JojaMart. To complete the Community Center, players need to complete Bundles for the Junimos by collecting and offering various items found in the Valley. Completing bundles rewards the player with exciting new items. Once all the bundles have been completed, the Community Center is repaired and the Junimos return to the forest.

On the other hand, if players opt to purchase a JojaMart Membership, the Community Center will turn into a Joja Warehouse instead. From there onward, all the bundles will be completed by the Joja Corporation. Players will need to pay a certain fee to Morris, the manager of JojaMart, through the Joja Community Development Form.

Build More Farm Buildings

Time to Ramp Up Production!

Now that your basic farm infrastructure is likely in place, consider expanding your farm in Year 2 by placing more specialized buildings. You can find the whole collection of farm buildings at the Carpenter’s Shop. Think about adding more Coops and Barns to house farm animals. These animals produce valuable resources like eggs, milk, wool, and even truffles (from pigs), which can be sold directly or, even better, processed into more profitable artisan goods in Stardew Valley .

Even seemingly smaller structures like a Silo for efficient hay storage or a Fish Pond for passive roe production can contribute significantly to your farm's overall efficiency and profitability as you settle into your second year.

item.title: 8 PS5 Games That Surpassed Expectations
item.description:
Summary

  • PlayStation's history of exceptional games is unmatched, with the PS5 showcasing a new wave of strong exclusives.
  • Unique and standout PS5 games like Rise of the Ronin and Stellar Blade deliver bold experiences that exceed expectations.
  • Returnal, Demon's Souls, and Helldivers 2 bring fresh gameplay, stunning graphics, and genre-bending fun to the PS5 library.

PlayStation's track record of amazing games is basically unlimited. Spanning several decades, a company that hosts a library of industry-defining titles that are generational in their caliber and quality, and have paved the way for many titles to follow. Shooters, RPGs, story games, and more, the impact that PlayStation has had on gaming is immeasurable, and the PS5 and its long list of exceptional games are yet another reminder that they are here to play and here to stay.

While exclusivity as a concept is certainly less restrictive than it used to be, with more and more games seeing multi-platform releases or being timed exclusives that get to be experienced on PC at a later date, there are still plenty of games that were born on the console and are only now entering the wider world for the rest to see. Plenty of titles remain locked to the PS5, providing more than enough incentive to pick one up. The level of quality that has come from this generation alone is unlike any other, and there are more than a few games that have cemented themselves as some of the greatest experiences in the history of gaming.

8 Rise Of The Ronin

Shape Your Destiny

Your comment has not been saved

Rise of the Ronin
8 /10
8.2 /10
OpenCritic Reviews
Top Critic Avg: 76 /100
Released
March 22, 2024

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
Mature 17+ // Blood and Gore, Language, Violence
Developer(s)
Team Ninja
Platform(s)
PC, PlayStation 5
OpenCritic Rating
Strong
Powered by

Rise of the Ronin arrived with tempered expectations, especially being a departure from Team Ninja’s previous Soulslike titles, but it quickly asserted itself as one of the most distinctive open-world experiences on the PlayStation 5. Japan might be an oversaturated video game location, but the game still manages to deliver a grounded historical narrative that is full of character and allows players the freedom to shape the course of revolution through moral choices and shifting alliances. The combat system is heavily steeped in swordplay and traditional weaponry and is just as brutal and precise as any samurai game on the market, striking a satisfying balance between challenge and fluidity.

Despite flying under the radar for many casual players, the game's attention to detail and refined mechanics propelled it into conversations usually dominated by more established franchises, and now that the game is available on PC, a whole new wave of players gets to experience the title's beauty and individuality. Its blend of RPG progression, stealth, and action offers a surprising amount of depth, encouraging players to engage with every corner of its meticulously crafted world, and has positioned itself as a serious contender among the PS5’s strongest exclusives, surpassing expectations with its ambition, scope, and compelling storytelling.

7 Marvel's Spider-Man 2

Swinging Into Action Once More

8 Images
8 Images

Your comment has not been saved

Marvel's Spider-Man 2
9 /10
44
8.8 /10
OpenCritic Reviews
Top Critic Avg: 88 /100
Released
October 20, 2023

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T For Teen Due To Blood, Drug Reference, Mild Language, Violence
Developer(s)
Insomniac Games
Platform(s)
PlayStation 5, PC
OpenCritic Rating
Mighty
Powered by

If the first entry into the modern Marvel world wasn't exciting enough, then Spider-Man 2 is more than enough to satisfy any open-world lover looking for some satisfying mobility and awesome action sequences. Bringing in Miles Morales as a secondary protagonist adds an extra level of depth not only to the story but to the gameplay itself. The ability to swap between the two gives the players a lot of control over how they approach certain situations, and with a unique set of abilities that each offers a slightly different playstyle, there is more than enough to keep players entertained no matter the mission or location.

The power of the PS5 really allows the game to shine, as the settings and graphics just look stunning, and it is almost as if the game was built for the console. Now that PC players can get their hands on the game, those limits will surely be pushed even further and open the door for so many more players to experience the title and for things like mods to become more widely available than before. It's the perfect action game for some more super-hero oriented fun, that doesn't take itself too seriously but still provides a story that is equally memorable and engaging.

6 Silent Hill 2

Welcome Back, Mr Sunderland

Your comment has not been saved

Silent Hill 2
9 /10
67
9 /10
OpenCritic Reviews
Top Critic Avg: 87 /100
Released
October 8, 2024

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ // Blood and Gore, Language, Sexual Themes, Violence
Developer(s)
Bloober Team
Platform(s)
PlayStation 5, PC
OpenCritic Rating
Mighty
Powered by

A return after so long, seeing the foggy streets of Silent Hill 2 feels just as strange and eerie as the setting itself, considering the time between its initial release and now. PlayStation and PC players both get to enjoy the game in all its glory, and even though the series is widely recognizable and an absolute horror classic, the success of this modern revival was both unexpected and extremely welcome, and can only lead to more successes and amazing games in the series down the line.

Part of what makes the remake so great is that it sticks to its roots. Much of the gameplay and the environment remain roughly the same, only with significantly better visuals and cleaner mechanics that remove all of the clunk, whilst keeping the horror intact. Millions of copies sold within the first few months, and it's no mystery why. The game just feels amazing to play, and the atmosphere oozes from the screen and touches the players in ways that other games struggle to. The psychological horror, combined with the gorgeous graphical fidelity, makes the game come alive and stands as one of the best remakes in the horror genre.

5 Returnal

A Surprising Bullet-Hell Hit

5 Images
5 Images

Your comment has not been saved

Returnal
10 /10
9 /10
OpenCritic Reviews
Top Critic Avg: 86 /100
Released
April 30, 2021

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T for Teen: Blood, Mild Language, Violence
Developer(s)
Housemarque
Platform(s)
PC, PlayStation 5
OpenCritic Rating
Mighty
Powered by

An unexpected gem that came out of nowhere, Returnal is a genre-blending fiesta that combines several elements and mechanics from roguelikes and shooters to create a truly distinct experience that was a surprising hit when it first landed on PS5 in 2021. Players jump into a looping world of aliens and technology straight out of a sci-fi fan's dream, incorporating progression mechanics that keep the game feeling fresh and having a core gameplay loop that is as punishing as it is rewarding.

Every moment is action-packed, and there are very few moments where the player gets any time at all to breathe before another set of attacks comes flying from across the screen. Now that the game is available on PC, players can really unlock the full potential of the title, as shooters are notoriously better to play with a mouse, and the game feels completely different, whilst still having all the same individuality that made it so successful on the PS5. A great shooter game that brought something new to the table, which will hopefully be blessed with a sequel in the near future.

4 Demon's Souls

The Best A Remake Can Be

Your comment has not been saved

Demon's Souls
10 /10
8.2 /10
OpenCritic Reviews
Top Critic Avg: 92 /100
Released
November 12, 2020

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Violence
Developer(s)
Bluepoint Games
Platform(s)
PlayStation 5
OpenCritic Rating
Mighty
Powered by

FromSoftware and PlayStation have a close and complex relationship that has spanned over a decade. The Souls games have always had a home on the PlayStation consoles, beginning with the original Demon's Souls back in 2009, with each new game in the catalog being found on the platform, including the coveted Bloodborne, a game that fans hold very near and dear. So with the announcement of a remake of the first in the series, the PS5 seemed like the obvious place to house the title, and the results speak for themselves.

All the charm and all of the stunning concepts remain, but are now so much nicer to look at and can be appreciated with significantly higher resolutions and fidelity, thanks to the PS5. The combat feels so much smoother, taking many of the elements from the later games and updating the feel to make the game more modern, whilst still retaining all the charm of the original. A remake of a classic title is a scary project to take on, but in this case, it was a massive success and blew away any expectations fans of the series had, as well as offering many newer fans the opportunity to experience the game that started a revolution.

3 Stellar Blade

Elegant And Beautifully Bleak

Your comment has not been saved

Stellar Blade
9 /10
16
8.4 /10
OpenCritic Reviews
Top Critic Avg: 82 /100
Released
April 26, 2024

WHERE TO PLAY

PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature
Developer(s)
Shift Up
Platform(s)
PS5
OpenCritic Rating
Strong
Powered by

A surprise standout among recent PS5 exclusives, that is now being made available for PC players, Stellar Blade has quickly established itself as a bold and stylish action title that exceeded expectations and delivered a familiar yet distinct experience in the genre. Combining lightning-fast combat with cinematic storytelling, the game has positioned itself alongside genre titans like Bayonetta and Nier: Automata as a female-led action title that isn't afraid to show off. What began as a flashy tech showcase evolved into a tightly constructed, narrative-driven experience, with protagonist Eve delivering both high-intensity battles and emotional depth that is rarely seen elsewhere.

What truly sets Stellar Blade apart and how it defied expectations was the level of polish and ambition present throughout. Oftentimes, a flashy new title can appear amazing on the surface, but fall short in execution when it releases. But here, the outcome is far greater than the impression, and the level of quality and depth is on par with titles coming from significantly more established developers in the scene. From dense enemy encounters that demand split-second timing to expansive environments filled with hidden lore and side quests, every element is designed to reward exploration and mastery. While some initially dismissed it as style over substance, the final product proves that both can coexist, and the game stands as an excellent entry into the action genre that not only justifies its place among the PS5 exclusives but also redefines what can be expected from a debut title on new hardware.

2 Helldivers 2

Movie Levels Of Action

6 Images
6 Images

Your comment has not been saved

Helldivers 2
9 /10
31
8.5 /10
OpenCritic Reviews
Top Critic Avg: 83 /100
Released
February 8, 2024

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ Due To Blood and Gore, Intense Violence
Developer(s)
Arrowhead Game Studios
Platform(s)
PC, PS5
OpenCritic Rating
Strong
Powered by

There have been several cases of games taking concepts and worlds from an original title, and shifting the gameplay over to a completely new perspective in an attempt to keep the universe intact, whilst offering something new for more players to enjoy. Helldivers 2 does exactly that, taking ideas that spawned from a top-down shooter, and bridging the gap between the original and a third-person shooter that is unapologetically absurd and wildly fun in every single way.

Whilst not being exclusive to the PS5, the game really thrives on the system thanks to the computing power it offers and the ability to show off the grandeur of the battles in all their glory. Combining extraction shooter mechanics with a battlefield full of insanity and hilarity, the game stands out as an exceptional shooter title that has very few others in the genre that compete with it. The fun is basically limitless, and the game is very much player-first, allowing them to engage with each mission however they choose, with increasing difficulty and levels of action that continue to impress every single time.

1 Astro Bot

A Return To Pure Fun

Your comment has not been saved

Astro Bot
10 /10
49
9.6 /10
OpenCritic Reviews
Top Critic Avg: 95 /100
Released
September 6, 2024

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
E10+ For Everyone 10+ Due To Crude Humor, Fantasy Violence
Developer(s)
Team Asobi
Platform(s)
PlayStation 5
OpenCritic Rating
Mighty
Powered by

Sometimes, the best games come from a place of love for the industry and don't try to overwhelm the player with complexity, and choose simple charm and fun instead. Astro has been around for a long time as a lovable mascot for the PlayStation consoles, but what started as a tutorial character to show off the new hardware has now become an icon of the gaming world in his in-game Astro Bot . It doesn't break any boundaries, blow many minds, or deliver an experience that will rock the player to the core. It does exactly what a game should: just be fun.

The world is simply a joy to explore and includes countless references and call-backs to iconic titles from all eras of PlayStation gaming. Cute worlds full of satisfying puzzles and crispy platforming, that never pushes the player too much but keeps them engaged for many hours on end, Astro Bot is a return to the days of old, where games were about making the player smile, and the game delivers that from start to finish. An unexpected game of the year winner, but certainly a deserving one, the fun and enjoyment that comes from the game should serve as a reminder that sometimes, players just want to have fun, and many future games should use Astro Bot as the crowning example of how to do it right.

item.title: Marvel Rivals Makes Change to Luna Snow Emote
item.description:
Summary

  • Marvel Rivals changed Luna Snow's Cyber Tunes emote to loop indefinitely, addressing player requests for a longer duration.
  • Other popular emotes include Venom twerking and Loki in a presidential pose, adding fun to matches.
  • New skins for Doctor Strange and Peni Parker come with unique emotes, expanding customization options.

Marvel Rivals has changed Luna Snow's Cyber Tunes emote, making it loop indefinitely. Like other shooters, the emotes in Marvel Rivals add a new way for players to express themselves during matches, making the experience even more engaging.

There are over 100 emotes in Marvel Rivals that players can obtain to equip. Some stand out, like the Venom emote released on April Fool's Day, finally addressing a recurring community joke and making the powerful symbiote twerk. Loki also has a very interesting emote where he goes into full presidential mode, with the god of mischief posing for the flashlights while doing the "V for victory." Another character who has a very popular emote is Luna Snow, and the developers have finally made a much-requested adjustment.

Marvel Rivals has changed Luna Snow's Cyber Tunes emote, and it now loops indefinitely. According to Miller Ross on Twitter, the change was made in the game's most recent patch, addressing a constant request from players to increase the duration from five seconds. The Cyber Tunes emote was released in February during Marvel Rivals Season 1 as part of the Mirae 2099 Bundle. The bundle includes the skin that gives the hero a futuristic outfit in shades of purple and pink, an MVP animation, spray, a nameplate, and an emote, all in the same aesthetic.

Other Luna Snow Emotes That Marvel Rivals Players Can Equip

The standard Luna Snow emote shows the Marvel Rivals Strategist in a simple animation in which she poses making a heart gesture with her hands. The other emote, called Little Oopsie, was introduced in December 2024 and shows the character creating a small snowman that slides out of her hand as she laughs and falls to the ground. This emote was introduced with the release of the Shining Star Bundle, which gave Luna an elegant skin with a dress partly made of glittering ice crystals, just like her left boot. Like other bundles, it comes with a skin, emote, MVP animation, spray, and nameplate following the same theme.

For players who want to check out the latest cosmetics, Marvel Rivals has added new skins for Doctor Strange and Peni Parker. Strange received the anticipated outfit inspired by his zombie version seen in Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness . As part of the bundle released by NetEase, the emote where one of the Souls of the Damned claws out of his chest is available. Peni received the Yatsukakahagi skin, whose bundle includes an emote in which her mecha jumps to scare and does a twirl afterward.

item.title: Dice Dreams: Free Rolls For April 2025
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Dice Dreams Links For April 2025
  • How To Redeem Dice Links In Dice Dreams

From attacking opponents and collecting resources to upgrading your kingdom, Dice Dreams is a great option for everyone who enjoys board games with a competitive twist. As the name implies, the core mechanic of Dice Dreams revolves around rolling dice to determine movement and actions on the board.

If you feel like your dice supply is running low, you can use dice links to get free rolls in Dice Dreams . With these free rolls, you can continue rolling the dice to build your kingdom, collect resources, and compete with other players to become the true Dice King.

Updated April 20, 2025, by Usama Ali: Dice Dreams, you need to roll the dice to earn coins, which can then be used to build and upgrade your kingdom. As you level up and move to the next kingdom, you'll realise that you need more dice. Thankfully, the developers often release Dice Dreams links that reward players with free dice rolls, coins, and other bonuses. These links are time-sensitive and can expire without warning. As such, it's important to claim them as soon as you find them. We're constantly updating this guide with the latest Dice Dreams links for a quick dice refill. Check back every day to claim your rewards.

We added five new links today.

These links are only active for a limited time period, so make sure to redeem them before they expire.

In addition to redeeming rewards from these links, you can earn rolls in Dice Dreams through various other methods. These include regularly participating in events, inviting friends to the game, and taking advantage of in-game promotions and offers. While spending real money is not recommended, you can invite new players or link your Facebook account to get rolls for free.

How To Redeem Dice Links In Dice Dreams

To redeem a link in Dice Dreams for its reward, you'll first have to click on the links mentioned above. These links will redirect you to another page where you'll see "Get." Click on that, and you'll be redirected to your game, where you'll receive the respective rewards instantly.

You need to have the Dice Dreams app installed before clicking on the link, or else the links and "Get" button will not work.

Make sure to only click on dice links from trustworthy sources to avoid malware or data leakage issues. The links included here have been tried and tested to ensure players don't run into any problems.

Dice Dreams is now available for Android and iOS.
